TypeSignature.Value: Public MustInherit Class AdapterView Inherits ViewGroup
public ref class AdapterView abstract : Android::Views::ViewGroup
.class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit AdapterView extends Android.Views.ViewGroup

Docs.summary: An AdapterView is a view whose children are determined by an Adapter.

remarks.para: An AdapterView is a view whose children are determined by an Adapter.

See ListView, GridView, Spinner and Gallery for commonly used subclasses of AdapterView.

Developer Guides
For more information about using AdapterView, read the Binding to Data with AdapterView developer guide.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable ReadOnly Property Count As Integer
public: virtual property int Count { int get(); };

Docs.value: The number of items owned by the Adapter associated with this AdapterView. (This is the number of data items, which may be larger than the number of visible views.)

remarks.para: Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

MemberSignature.Value: Public Overridable Property EmptyView As View
public: virtual property Android::Views::View ^ EmptyView { Android::Views::View ^ get(); void set(Android::Views::View ^ value); };
public virtual Android.Views.View? EmptyView { get; set; }
member this.EmptyView : Android.Views.View with get, set

Docs.summary: When the current adapter is empty, the AdapterView can display a special view called the empty view. -or- Sets the view to show if the adapter is empty
Docs.value: The view to show if the adapter is empty.

remarks.para: Property getter documentation:

When the current adapter is empty, the AdapterView can display a special view called the empty view. The empty view is used to provide feedback to the user that no data is available in this AdapterView.
Property setter documentation:
Sets the view to show if the adapter is empty
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.param: an adapter item, or a descendant of an adapter item. This must be visible in this AdapterView at the time of the call.
Docs.summary: Returns the position within the adapter's data set for the view, where view is a an adapter item or a descendant of an adapter item.
Docs.returns: the position within the adapter's data set of the view, or #INVALID_POSITION if the view does not correspond to a list item (or it is not currently visible)

remarks.para: Returns the position within the adapter's data set for the view, where view is a an adapter item or a descendant of an adapter item.

Note: The result of this method only reflects the position of the data bound to view during the most recent layout pass. If the adapter's data set has changed without a subsequent layout pass, the position returned by this method may not match the current position of the data within the adapter.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

Docs.summary: Represents an invalid position.

remarks.para: Represents an invalid position. All valid positions are in the range 0 to 1 less than the number of items in the current adapter.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance bool PerformItemClick(class Android.Views.View view, int32 position, int64 id) cil managed
abstract member PerformItemClick : Android.Views.View * int * int64 -> bool override this.PerformItemClick : Android.Views.View * int * int64 -> bool

Docs.param: The view within the AdapterView that was clicked.
The position of the view in the adapter.
The row id of the item that was clicked.
Docs.summary: Call the OnItemClickListener, if it is defined.
Docs.returns: True if there was an assigned OnItemClickListener that was called, false otherwise is returned.

remarks.para: Call the OnItemClickListener, if it is defined. Performs all normal actions associated with clicking: reporting accessibility event, playing a sound, etc.
Portions of this page are modifications based on work created and shared by the Android Open Source Project and used according to terms described in the Creative Commons 2.5 Attribution License.
